noun.description: An oval fleshy fruit that is purple, reddish, or yellow when ripe and contains a flattish pointed pit.
The deciduous tree that bears the plum.
A highly desirable attainment, accomplishment, or acquisition, typically a job.
examples: he landed a plum assistant producer's job
the helicopter crashed plum on the cabins

origin: Old English plūme, from medieval Latin pruna, from Latin prunum (see prune).
